text:
J. PERIOD: Remixing is a concept
that is native to hip hop

but has become, you know, sort
of common lexicon in the world.

And it refers to this
idea of taking a familiar

and flipping it,
and changing it,

turning it on its head to sort
of expose some new part of it.

So when we talk about
remixing the narrative,

we're talking about taking
familiar narratives--

such as the narrative of the
melting pot, the melting pot,
the American melting pot--

and remixing that
in a different way.

So we have an idea
that the DJ crossfader

is an incredibly
powerful metaphor
for bringing people together.

Because rather than having
everything melt into one,

you have these two
distinct pieces the songs
on each different turntable.

And then the crossfader
is an implement

for finding the
points of connection
between those things.

And we think that that is a
much better and more suitable

metaphor when we're talking
about the state of race
relations in this country.

The Rise Up Project that
we are working on right now

features music from artists
from the Playlist Retreat--

a gathering that Jazzy
Jeff puts together

where incredibly talented
musicians and producers
and DJ's get together.

We brought this
conversation to that event.

And the result was
an incredible array

of music that was created
in response to these issues
whether--

you know the police violence
that was occurring last year

or some of the political
issues that are happening now.

And so there's a
song called "Miranda"

which we have out right
now featuring Rhymefest--

Academy Award winning
writer of the song "Glory"

for John Legend and
Common and Xzibit,
and actor Jesse Williams--

where really the message, as
Rhymefest puts it, is "we're

pointing fingers at each other
and we're missing the point."

In other words, we are laying
this blame in places where it

does not belong
and we're missing

the fact that we all
actually have more in common
than we do not.
